item.title: Machine Learning Engineer, Data Enablement, Advanced Analytics & AI
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

Job Description

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients. At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

Embedded within the Advanced Analytics & AI (EAA) group, we are a blended team of full-stack Data Scientists and ML Engineers. Our mandate is to build and deploy machine learning models as data products and services. As an enterprise group we work with multiple partners and use-case types across our bank, including Marketing, Client Operations, Payments and many other business groups.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Science Expertise: You will use your expertise in Machine Learning to develop reproducible models, develop model evaluation, training and monitoring pipelines.

  • MLOps: You will utilize your strong Python programming skills to refactor experimental notebooks into production grade Python modules using functional programming. You will deploy batch models to production by utilizing tools such as Jenkins. You will create tables in our feature/model serving store as a means to store our batch model outputs via Python. You will assist with the maintenance and monitoring of models and data services in production.

  • Champion Best Practices: You will champion the team’s code-style, work-flow patterns and project structure standards You will lead by example by writing great documentation, practicing test-driven-development and properly annotating your code.

  • Trusted Partner: You will actively engage with other data scientists, engineers & business clientele to build trust and credibility. You will support your colleagues in areas by sharing ideas and brainstorming approaches to problems.

What We’re Looking For

  • Demonstrated knowledge of data science & machine learning with Python using common data science libraries, such as the PyData stack, and other ML frameworks

  • Strong Python programming skills including creating/debugging Python scripts in an non-notebook environment (e.g. PyCharm or VSCode) and writing modular code in a functional programming style.

  • Demonstrated knowledge writing SQL scripts to query relational databases and data warehouses

  • Familiarity with git, GitHub & conda

  • Familiarity with Linux systems & proficient at writing basic bash scripts

  • A conceptual understanding or exposure to Docker.

  • Any of these would be considered an asset :

    • Familiarity with the Flask or FastAPI web frameworks

    • Any exposure to DevOps tools, such as Jenkins and writing Jenkins pipelines is a big plus

    • Familiarity with scripting in SAS and SAS Enterprise Guide       

    • Familiarity working with git branching and merging

    • Familiarity with Microsoft Azure cloud platform

    • Familiarity with front-end frameworks, such as Bootstrap & Angular.

  • You have an a degree in: computer science, engineering, the natural sciences, math, other related quantitative field, or relevant work experience.

  • Minimum 1 year of relevant experience working either in industry, academia or co-op programs.

  • You have a strong sense of intellectual curiosity. You are intellectually curious and often think about ways to improve how we work. You may not know every tool or framework, but your innate sense of curiosity drives you to learn and grow your technical and business acumen. Along the same lines, you will have plenty of training opportunities and support from your peers and manager to fill in the gaps in your skill sets.

  • You embrace change and champion analytics. You empower and enable your team to make continuous improvement. You enjoy sharing knowledge and ideas with your colleagues & business partners, becoming an engaged member of the analytics community at our bank.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home.

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity.

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training.

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified below and where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-CC North 26th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Consultant, BILLING & SERVICE ANALYTICS - Outsourced Technology and Azure Cloud
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Consultant – Billing & Service Analytics, you will be supporting the financial and contractual governance of our outsourced technology and cloud infrastructure services.  You will use a variety of tools and processes to create meaningful analytics from both structured and unstructured data.  These outputs will be used to provide effective decision support guidance for our internal partners and senior executives.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Financial Management Expertise – Must have prior work experience with core financial management and accounting activities such as planning, forecasting, accruals, and financial variance reporting. 
  • Information Technology Outsourcing and Public Cloud – Must have previous experience with, and a working understanding of outsourced information technology and public cloud infrastructure.
  • Data Engineering and Data Science – Must have an awareness of current tools and methods used to support data engineering and data science analytics to provide insight and decision support for Senior Executives and management within CIBC.
  • Creative Problem Solving – Demonstrated ability to thrive in ambiguity, understand business context quickly and connect the dots. Must be comfortable operating at a strategic level and also driving into detail as needed, and back. Continuous improvement is part of your DNA.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILL REQUIREMENTS

Subject Matter Expertise:

  • Logical Data Modeling--Knowledge of activities, tasks, processes, deliverables and techniques for analyzing and documenting conceptual/logical data models to capture domain knowledge and business rules.

Extensive Work Experience:

  • Modeling: Data, Process, Events, Objects--Knowledge of activities, tasks, processes, deliverables and techniques for analyzing and documenting logical relationships among the data, process or events.
  • Accuracy/Attention to Detail--Ability to process information with high levels of accuracy.

Work Experience:

  • Problem Solving--Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems.
  • Database Structures--Knowledge of a database management structures (relational, hierarchical., distributed...) and associated platforms.
  • Data Movement Tools--Knowledge of tools, techniques and practices for movement of electronic data.

Who You Are

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-483 Bay St, 5th floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Cloud Infrastructure, Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Microsoft Cloud, Platform as a Service (PaaS), Public Clouds

item.title: Consultant, Risk Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Small Business Risk Management, you will be well versed in designing, building and implementing account acquisition and account management strategies with a focus on increasing auto-approval rates and decreasing loss rates. Expert level SAS, SQL coding skills are required to extract value from data combined with strong communication skills for presentation of risk-reward analysis to Senior Management. Reporting (standard and ad hoc) will require attention to detail and accuracy.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data driven - Actively work with other business partners across the organization to ensure that work is aligned to our mandate and objectives.   Lead and support in-depth client insights studies using SAS, and create an analytical framework to help solve key business questions and test hypotheses. A strong understanding of reporting, analysis and data mining combined with  practical industry experience is required.
  • Continuous improvement mindset – Execute a strong focus on process improvement. Regularly identify, develop and implement operational process enhancements with the goal of improving efficiencies and synergies between internal and external partners.
  • Communication and relationship management - Lead and assist in preparing comprehensive presentations as needed to highlight key insights from deep dive analysis along with any recommendations that can be adopted to help address gaps or opportunities.  Manage a number of high priority requests to support management in order to support the bank’s strategy. Interact and work effectively across multiple internal teams, and establish a process to facilitate data/information sharing that ensures a consistent, common understanding of key client metrics.
  • Critical thinking - Apply critical thinking, creativity and sound judgement to identify issues and opportunities.  You can sort through complex and ambiguous scenarios to understand root causes and make tough but reasoned choices between competing alternatives and opinions.  You seek to understand before proposing solutions and although you intuitively know something doesn’t make sense, you rely on data and fact to inform decisions and recommendations rather than opinion. Openly and frequently share your knowledge, ideas and views because you know your perspective matters.
  • Project execution - Own and lead projects from inception to execution – such as, working with all stakeholders across the organization to develop a holistic client contribution framework & assessment to the automation of the entire process. Stay abreast of industry best practices regarding analytical methods and technologies.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience with at least 3-5 years’ experience and strong skills in data extraction/manipulation and statistical analysis tools, including SAS (required), SQL; comfort with exploring how new and emerging data can be used; Knowledge of data visualization tools such as COGNOS, Tableau, etc. is an asset. Working in applied data & analytics problems in retail banking, including is an asset.  Experience creating Access/VBA based reporting databases is an strong asset.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you
  • You have a degree/diploma in a relevant bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or quantitative discipline such as Applied Statistics; related banking/business/finance knowledge is considered an asset
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-CC East 10th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Manager, Unsecured Lending Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

Manager, Unsecured Lending Analytics

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Manager, Unsecured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – You integrate domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements)
  • Analytics – You identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  You appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  You proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – You leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – You think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
  • This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.
  • Job location is 33 Yonge Street, 7th floor, however, this may change dependent on business need.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Expected End Date

2021-08-02

Job Location

Toronto-33 Yonge Street, 3rd

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

Job Description

Senior Manager, Unsecured Lending Analytics

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Senior Manager, Unsecured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader in analytics consulting – Integrate deep domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements
  • Analytics – Independently identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  Appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  Proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – Leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – Orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. item.title: Manager, Pension Analytics, Performance & Operations
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing    


Pension Investment Management (PIM), Treasury has overall responsibility to develop and operate a sustainable investment strategy for the bank’s defined benefit pension plans. The bank operates a complex and market leading pension investment management function in a bespoke manner to meet its unique objectives as the only top-5 tier bank to continue to offer its employees an open defined benefit pension plan. The PIM group is led by the Chief Investment Officer and comprises a team of four investment professionals who manage over $8BN in assets across both public and private markets. The Manager, Pension Analytics, Performance & Operations is responsible for the delivery of insightful quantitative analysis and modelling that supports top-down pension management recommendations, asset allocation decisions, portfolio construction optimization and development of bespoke asset class strategies. In addition, timely reporting to support investment monitoring and oversight activities, as well as frontline risk management of funded status, balance sheet impact, hedging programs and liquidity capacity .
 

How You’ll Succeed


Reporting & Analysis - Managing the end-to-end quarterly investment reporting process including the production of investment returns, their validation with managers, attribution analysis, identification of key performance drivers, portfolio positioning review, aggregation of risk positions across investments, and generation of final reports.

Analytics and Modelling- Identifying meaningful analytics from which tangible management actions can be taken in relationto performance and risk management as well as Developing and maintaining models of pension assets and liabilities.

Managing Systems & Process- Independently running the monthly pension reporting process including estimates of funded status, balance sheet impact, attribution of changes, and key risk sensitivities., managing the private markets monitoring system in near real time and developing subject matter expertise on the system, managing updates to investment policy, pension governance documents and the business unit’s process documentation, managing the month-end asset valuation process with pension accounting and investment managers with the direction and review of senior team members. General operational management of the investment program including investment administration, cash management and ensuring control processes are upheld at all times.

Who You Are

o    Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
o    You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
o    You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
o    You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information using strong financial modelling, analytical and valuation skills. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

o    You have demonstrated experience working on and supporting the delivery of pension investment strategy through a combination of actuarial, risk management, quantitative modelling, asset liability management, performance/attribution reporting and governance roles (5-7 years). You have knowledge of institutional investment assets and cash management at an operational level. In addition, you have a degree in actuarial science, risk management, quantitative discipline, economics, finance or a related subject as a prerequisite. It\'s an asset if you have a CFA, FRM and/or actuarial designation(s).

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-161 Bay St 11th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Consultant, Strategy
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

How You’ll Succeed

  • Strategic Problem Solving – Frame complex problem to be addressed, identify and execute required analysis with Analytics partners, and synthesize key findings to help the teams reach decisions
  • Analytics & Insights – Leverage internal CIBC data, external data and insights to develop a story and drive the need for change. Quantify impacts to the client and employee experience. Support pilots and bring meaning to data and results.  Build, develop and sustain data models & algorithms that support key strategic recommendations and decisions related to frontline distribution.  Lead work packages to enhance or implement new operating models, procedures and standards by researching/analyzing relevant data, and developing proposals and recommendations
  • Consulting – Foster collaborative relationships with internal stakeholders and peers. Provide value-added advisory support on strategic direction and best practices.  Participate and support in in-flight projects to ensure that the strategic vision and its benefits are realized.  Stay connected with the client journey and engage with our frontline partners regularly to understand the current strengths and challenges

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate knowledge of strategic planning principles sufficient to identify and develop initiatives. You have a strong understanding of Personal & Business Banking and enhanced technical knowledge in order to deal with more complex problems independently. You have superb analytical and financial acumen with developed knowledge in several areas of Financial Services sufficient to interpret, analyze and apply relevant issues and developments.
  • You are a problem solver.  You have creative problem solving skills sufficient to resolve or identify innovative alternatives or opportunities where established procedures for problems sometimes do not exist.
  • You deliver with urgency. You have the ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, groups or activities.  Effective judgment in prioritizing and time allocation
  • You have strong technical skills. You can demonstrate financial modeling skills in working with large datasets and ability to synthesize complex problems and solutions to “easy to understand” concepts.
  • Education. Background in Finance, Business, Computer Engineering/Science based discipline. Relevant graduate degree (MBA) or management consultant experience is an asset. 
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You have well-developed presentation skills, highly-developed writing skills, and influential skills sufficient to accomplish "significant" promotion & negotiation on CIBC’s behalf and to convince others of the value of preferred options or alternatives in situations where distinct differences of opinion or approach exist.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
